column2: Responsibilities: System Design and Development: Collaborate with clients and stakeholders to gather requirements for building automation and control systems. Design, develop, and implement Niagara-based solutions tailored to the unique needs of each project. Configure and program controllers, sensors, and other devices to integrate seamlessly within the Niagara Framework. Integration: Integrate various building systems, such as HVAC, lighting, security, and energy management, into the Niagara platform. Ensure smooth communication between different protocols and devices using Niagara's integration capabilities. Customization and Scripting: Develop custom scripts and modules using Niagara's scripting languages (e.g., Niagara Framework Script, BajaScript) to enhance system functionality. Create custom graphics, dashboards, and user interfaces to provide clients with intuitive visualization and control options. Testing and Troubleshooting: Conduct thorough testing of developed solutions to identify and address any bugs, issues, or inconsistencies. Perform troubleshooting of complex system interactions, communication problems, and integration challenges. Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of system design, configuration, custom scripts, and troubleshooting procedures. Provide clear and concise documentation for clients and internal teams to facilitate future maintenance and upgrades. Client Communication: Communicate regularly with clients to ensure their requirements are met and expectations are managed effectively. Provide technical guidance and support to clients regarding system operation, troubleshooting, and potential improvements. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent work experience). Minimum of 5 years of experience working with the Niagara Framework in building automation and control systems. Proficiency in developing, configuring, and troubleshooting Niagara-based solutions. Strong understanding of various protocols such as BACnet, Modbus, LonWorks, and others commonly used in building automation. Experience with custom scripting and programming within the Niagara Framework. Familiarity with HVAC, lighting, security, and energy management systems. Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to diagnose and resolve complex technical issues. Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, for client interaction and documentation. Ability to work independently as well as in a collaborative team environment. Relevant Niagara certifications (e.g., Niagara 4 Developer, Niagara AX Certification) are a plus.
column11: Niagara Framework, BajaScript, Niagara

column2: As a    Variant Configuration Lead Modeler    , you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world. Here, you will make an impact by:        Design and implement variant configuration models for new products and maintain/deploy existing models.      Utilize best practices and efficiently utilize Variant Configuration (VC) objects like characteristics, classes, configuration profiles, constraints, procedures, selection conditions, super bom, super recipe, variant table, user interface, variant pricing.      Understand material variants, price linking, and sales order costing.      Examine existing models/processes and identify opportunities to improve and/or add automation.      Document model requirements in work instructions/job aids for product support.              Your Skills and Expertise        To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M requires (at a minimum) the following qualifications:        Bachelor s degree or higher in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field of study (completed and verified prior to start) from an accredited institution.      Six (6) years of experience in SAP Variant Configuration (VC), Advanced Variant Configuration (AVC) and Solution Sales Configurator (SSC) with at least 2 full cycle SAP implementations.      Experience with VC system configuration in S4/ECC with emphasis around SD and PP modules. Relevant cross-functional knowledge of integration points with other SAP modules.      Excellent communication skills (verbal and written). Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences. Ability to work with business partners in different locales/time zones. Ability to collaborate with global VC team in US and UK, shift 2pm - 11pm.      Experience building VC models in a manufacturing sector.            Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:        S/4 HANA project experience. column2: At IBM, we view work as more than just a job; it's a calling. Our mission is to build, design, code, consult, and lead in this new era of technology, solving some of the most complex problems. This role centers on understanding clients' needs regarding people outcomes and crafting solutions that leverage IBM HR capabilities to deliver those outcomes. As a Deputy Group Manager, you'll collaborate with the best minds at IBM, interact with clients to align with their business needs, and engage multiple stakeholders to ensure the successful delivery of solutions. You'll serve as a catalyst for change, enhancing the employee experience for our clients. Your Role and Responsibilities As a Subject Matter Expert in EDM/Core HR Transaction Processing, you will be a pivotal member of our HR operations team, ensuring the accurate and efficient processing of employee data management (EDM) and Core HR transactions. Your expertise will be instrumental in maintaining data integrity, optimizing HR processes, and providing exceptional service to our client stakeholders and employees Transaction Processing: Oversee the end-to-end processing of EDM/Core HR transactions, including but not limited to employee onboarding, offboarding, transfers, promotions, salary changes, and data updates. Data Integrity: Ensure the accuracy, completeness, and consistency of employee data in the HRIS (Human Resources Information System) and other relevant systems, conducting regular audits and validations to identify and resolve discrepancies. Compliance: Ensure compliance with relevant laws, regulations, and internal policies governing data privacy, confidentiality, and data security, maintaining up-to-date knowledge of compliance requirements and best practices. Process Improvement: Identify opportunities to streamline and standardize transaction processing workflows, enhance efficiency, and reduce manual interventions through automation, system enhancements, and process optimization. Quality Assurance: Conduct quality checks and reviews of transactional data, reports, and outputs to ensure accuracy, consistency, and adherence to established standards and guidelines. Issue Resolution: Investigate and resolve escalated transactional issues, discrepancies, and inquiries from stakeholders, providing timely and effective resolution and communication. Training and Knowledge Sharing: Provide training, guidance, and support to HR staff, managers, and other stakeholders on transaction processing procedures, system functionalities, and best practices, fostering a culture of continuous learning and development. Vendor Management: Collaborate with external service providers, vendors, and partners involved in transaction processing activities, ensuring service level agreements are met, and issues are addressed promptly and effectively. Reporting and Analysis: Prepare and distribute regular and ad-hoc reports, metrics, and analyses related to transaction processing activities, providing insights, trends, and recommendations to support decision-making and process improvement initiatives Required Technical and Professional Expertise Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Information Systems, or related field. Overall 10-12 years of experience in HR processes with minimum 5-7 years of experience in HR transaction processing, with a focus on employee data management (EDM) and Core HR processes In-depth knowledge of HRIS systems, EDM tools, and Core HR processes, with hands-on experience using relevant software and technologies. Strong understanding of HR policies, procedures, regulations, and compliance requirements related to transaction processing activities. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify, analyze, and resolve transactional issues and discrepancies. Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate and communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels of the organization. Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Excellent written and verbal communication skills  Good organizational skills including attention to detail and multitasking skills Hands-on exp of Microsoft Office Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Professional certification in HRIS or HR transaction processing. Experience with ERP systems such as SAP, Oracle, Workday, or similar platforms. Experience with process mapping, process documentation, and process improvement methodologies such as Lean or Six Sigma. Experience with data analytics, reporting tools, and dashboards for HR transaction processing metrics and analysis.
column11: hr policies, core hr, hris systems, edm, hr processes, transaction processing, erp, six sigma, data analytics, sap, oracle, hris, employee data management, process improvement, business administration, process mapping, promotions, lean

column2: Designation Project Manager IT (SAP)        Job Description      Minimum 2 end to end SAP Implementation as project manager.      Provide Application strategy & direction on all SAP service.      Ensure all SAP application services are available within the prescribed services levels.      Ensure the ICT suppliers are compliant with their change management protocols      related to SAP environment (both management and technical).      Ensure the ICT suppliers have full control and management of their supply chain      within the SAP environment.      Work closely with the ICT suppliers to determine the SAP applications roadmap and      service delivery processes.      As an intermediary between Business process owners and the SAP support      organization in relation to development, implementation and support of SAP      functionality.      Responsibility to ensure the continuity of SAP Processes.      Responsible to manage both application as well as infrastructure.      Should have excellent understanding of SAP solutions and of the consulting business      processes and functions.      Responsible to manage the relationship with functional and technical consultants.      During first phases of the Go Live the role will predominantly focus on Incident      Management, Route Cause Analysis and SAP change Management processes.      Maintain contact with LoB Heads, BPOs, Power Users and advise on the functional      and technical feasibility regarding Request for Changes, advising if solutions are most      appropriate      To manage the relationship with functional and technical consultants to provide both      incident resolution and development services      To ensure that procedures, quality assurance, templates and documentation      according to the current SAP standards      To participate in User Group meetings with business to balance the requirements of      the BPOs functional owner with planning, priority and budget      Well conversant with SAP developments in the functional area      To inform and plan new developments in SAP with Module Leads.      Maintain the integrity, manageability and architectural aspects of the SAP systems      Review and guide on Solution Maps for functional and technical issues / challenges      Implementation of Security Policy in the SAP environment      IT Operations Management      IT Service Delivery Management      IT Security Management      IT Cost savings and Budget control Management      IT Process Control      Desired Profile Exceptional leadership, organizational and interpersonal skills.      Experience 10 + years      Functional Area Information Technology      Education B.E (Computers/Electronics & Telecommunication) /MBA (IT)

column1: Executive SAP PP/QM with Pharma at Thane
column2: Designation : Exeutive SAP PP/QM Job location : Thane, Mumbai Experience : 3-7 years in implementation of either SAP PP / QM module. Candidates having experience in manufacturing sector - Pharmaceutical / Chemical / Agro Chemical / Specialty Chemicals / FMCG manufacturing etc preferred.  SAP certiifcation in SAP PP / QM Module preferred.  Minimum one full lifecycle in SAP S/4 implementations either PP/QM Module Person should be responsible to analyse, design, development, improvement, maintenance, testing, and support manufacturing functions, programs, applications, interface, daily operation and other functional objects in the SAP PP / QM Module & integration with other modules like SAP MM / Costing etc. Fair Knowledge of entire SAP PP cycle include Material requirements planning, Capacity levelling & capacity planning. Master data types include Materials master, BOM, Multi-level BOM, Recipe, Work centre, Routing process under Production Planning Familiarity of SAP QM module and functioning in SAP S/4 HANA Master Data, Inspection Methods, Sampling, Inspection Plan, Quality Info Records, Lot Inspection, Result recording, Usage Decision, Listing Inspection lot, In-Process Inspection, Final Inspection, Defects Recording, Quality Notification  Creation and modification of Bill of material, Recipe, PP module configuration. Planning strategies - Make to Stock Planning & Make to Order planning strategy. Process & understanding of Planned order to Production Order conversion, Process Orders, Material Staging. Basic understanding of Scheduling, Production Costing (Plan Cost, Actual Cost, Target cost) Capacity Planning in Work Centre Knowledge of MRP parameters required to run material requirement planning to meet Planned Independent. Production Order creation process - Directly from Stock Requirement List & Using Planned Order number. Fair knowledge of PP / QM module authorization controls MRP Controller is an individual or group of persons who are responsible to check material availability. Incumbent should liaison with Business users to understand the Business gaps & Production / Quality process in Plant, coordinate with SAP partner & close the gaps. He/she should be able to envisage the automation & reduction of manual processes in PP / QM module by undertaking necessary RICEFs & continuously improve & enhance the PP/QM business processes. Interested candidates can share CV on chitra.a@alivira.in

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:             Manage the work streams related to IT SOX compliance covering ITGC and IT Dependencies (ITAC, Interfaces, IPE s).     Thorough understanding around ITGC domains such as Logical Access, Change Management, SDLC and Computer Operations.     Exposure of testing IT Application Controls (Configurable, Non-configurable), Interfaces, IPE s, Data Migration and Platform Reviews.     Provide technical support in the assessment, design, and implementation of ITGC requirements.     Review control evidence for adherence to accuracy, completeness, and precision of control execution for all ITGC.     Develop, implement, and test controls for new acquisitions and in-scope entities     Work with control owners and operators to ensure quality, consistency, and operability of new and existing controls.     Collaborate and build long-term relationships with key stakeholders in a fast-paced and matrixed work environment.     Review test findings, facilitate the remediation of ITGC control gaps, and escalate possible critical issues to senior management within IT.     Mentors and develops peer and associates, monitors their work, and takes corrective action when necessary     Builds and maintains strong peer relationships within the team and across the organization     Coordinates work with External Auditors.             Interpersonal Skills:             Ability to work independently under general supervision with latitude for initiative and independent judgment     Effective verbal and written communications, including active listening skills     Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with co-workers and external contactors/auditors     Detail-oriented     Comfortable working on multiple projects simultaneously     Individuals would be expected to cultivate a strong team environment and promote a positive working relationship amongst their team.     Excellent Communication, written and verbal would be expected.     In addition to being an exceptional individual contributor, manage engagements and relevant Teams allocated for the same.     Managing predominantly offshore engagements and relevant PwC Territory teams.     Ensure client service delivery in accordance with the quality guidelines methodologies.     Build and maintain client relationships by understanding and being responsive to client needs and ensuring high quality of deliverables.     Demonstrate strong analytical thinking and communication skills including the ability to research and understand complex processes and effectively communicate them to interested parties             Client Management:             Develop strong working relationships with the client and onshore client teams.     Maintain excellent rapport and proactive communication with the stakeholders and client.             Operational excellence:             Suggest ideas on improving engagement productivity and identify opportunities for improving client service.     Ensure compliance with engagement plans and internal quality risk management procedures.             People related:             Display teamwork, integrity, and leadership. Work with team members to set goals and responsibilities for specific engagements.     Foster teamwork and innovation.     Utilize technology tools to continually learn and innovate, share knowledge with team members and enhance service delivery.     Conduct workshops and technical training sessions for team members.     Contribute to the learning development agenda and knowledge harnessing initiatives             Minimum Qualifications:             Bachelor s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science Engineering, or Finance Preferred     B.E., B. TECH, M. TECH, MCA, BCA, CA, MBA     Experience in technology audit, risk management, compliance, consulting, or information security     Excellent knowledge of IT General Controls, automated and security controls.     Knowledge of security measures and auditing practices within various operating systems, databases, and applications     Experience in auditing financial applications, cyber security practices, privacy, and various infrastructure platforms such as Unix, Linus, Windows, SQL Server, Oracle Databases     Knowledge and concepts of auditing of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure and Google Cloud)     Experience designing continuous auditing and monitoring tools and techniques is a plus.     Good understanding of CoBIT 5 Domains of Access Management, SLDC Change and Computer Operations and Control Design and Testing of SOX IT General Controls (ITGC) and/or IT Application Controls (ITAC)     Experience in identifying control gaps and communicating audit findings and control redesign recommendations to Management/Clients     Knowledge of regulations impacting privacy, integrity, and availability of clients PII.     Functional knowledge of major ERP suites (like SAP, Dynamics, Oracle EBS)     Understanding of audit concepts and regulations     Required overall experience in testing/reviewing and implementation of ITGC controls, CoBit 5 and developing COSO framework     Candidates with 3-5 years of relevant experience in similar role, preferably with a Big 4 or equivalent     Chartered Accountant (would be added advantage)             Certification(s) preferred:             CISA / CISM / CRISC / CISSP / ISO 27001 LA certifications                 Mandatory skill sets- ITGC   Preferred skill sets - Cyber Security   Year of experience required -5-8 years   Qualifications- BE/Btech/MBA/MCA/Mtech/MSc/Bsc

Position Requirements:              Design, develop and maintain SAP HANA solutions that meet the business requirements and adhere to the best practices and standards.              Provide technical guidance and support to junior associates and other team members on SAP EDW (SAP BTP and Datasphere) topics              Troubleshoot and resolve SAP Data model issues and ensure data quality and integrity.              Collaborate with business users, functional consultants, and other stakeholders to understand the business needs and translate them into SAP HANA solutions              Conduct testing, documentation, and training for SAP solutions              Stay updated on the latest SAP Data warehousing technologies and trends and propose improvements and innovations.              Technical Skills:              Bachelors or Masters degree in a relevant field (e.g., computer science, information systems, engineering).              Minimum of 6 years of experience in HANA Native development and configurations, including at least 1 year with SAP BTP Cloud Foundry and HANA Cloud.              Demonstrated experience in working with various data sources SAP(      SAP ECC, SAP CRM, SAP S/4HANA)      and non-SAP (Oracle, Salesforce, AWS)              Demonstrated expertise in designing and implementing solutions utilizing the SAP BTP platform.              Solid understanding of BTP HANA Cloud and its service offerings.              Strong focus on building expertise in constructing calculation views within the HANA Cloud environment (BAS) and other supporting data artifacts.              Experience with HANA XS Advanced and HANA 2.0 versions.              Ability to optimize queries and data models for performance in SAP HANA development environment and sound understanding of indexing, partitioning and other performance optimization techniques.              Proven experience in applying SAP HANA Cloud development tools and technologies, including HDI containers, HANA OData Services , HANA XSA, strong SQL scripting, SDI/SLT replication, Smart Data Access (SDA) and Cloud Foundry UPS services.              Experience with ETL processes and tools (SAP Data Services Preferred).              Ability to debug and optimize existing queries and data models for performance.              Hands-on experience in utilizing Git within Business Application Studio and familiarity with Github features and repository management.              Familiarity with reporting tools and security based concepts within the HANA development environment.              Understanding of the HANA Transport Management System, HANA Transport Container and CI/CD practices for object deployment.              Knowledge of monitoring and troubleshooting techniques for SAP HANA BW environments.              Familiarity with reporting tools like SAC/Power BI building dashboards and consuming data models is a plus.              HANA CDS views: (added advantage)              Understanding of associations, aggregations, and annotations in CDS views.              Ability to design and implement data models using CDS.                  Certification in SAP HANA or related areas is a plus              Functional knowledge of SAP business processes (FI/CO, MM, SD, HR).

column2: As the SAP S/4HANA Transformation Leader, you will play a pivotal role in steering the companys transition to SAPs next-generation ERP suite, S/4HANA. Leveraging your extensive expertise, you will lead modernization of SAP S/4HANA solutions, ensuring seamless integration Business Technology Platforms connecting to S4/HANA with modern technologies such as APIs and Data Lakes. The successful candidate will have a track record of successfully executing and modernizing multiple S/4HANA is required.               Key Deliverables in this role:                 Business Context Understanding: Develop a deep understanding of the industry, business processes, and key performance indicators (KPIs) to provide relevant business partnership             Lead the end-to-end implementation of SAP S/4HANA, ensuring alignment with business objectives and industry best practices.             Implementation ofDevSecOps solution for S4HANA suite.                 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and refine business processes, ensuring optimization and efficiency gains.             Ability to develop a comprehensive training program for end-users and support teams.             Act as a subject matter expert, providing guidance on SAP S/4HANA best practices and emerging trends in ERP and related technologies.                 Drive continuous improvement initiatives, identifying opportunities to enhance system performance, reliability, and user experience.             Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards in all SAP S/4HANA implementations.           Innovation and Learning     Innovation & People Management           Provide strategic guidance on the adoption of modern technologies, including API integration and Data Lake solutions.             Establish strong relationships with external partners and vendors, ensuring effective collaboration and successful project delivery.             Manage and lead a functional consultant team of 10 or more members, fostering a collaborative and high-performance team culture.             Stay abreast of industry developments, emerging technologies, and SAP updates to drive innovation and maintain a competitive edge.               What are the Critical success factors for the Role ?               12- 15 years of experience in SAP implementation and transformation projects, with a focus on S/4HANA.             Proven track record of successfully leading multiple SAP S/4HANA implementations within a global context.             Expertise in modern technologies, including API integration and Data Lakes.             Strong understanding and implementation experience with satellite systems while compliment core business processes like Planning tool, Order Management tools, TMS, WMS, vendor portal, vendor invoice processing etc.             In-depth knowledge of SAP modules relevant to FMCG, with a focus on supply chain and logistics.             Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse stakeholders.             Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to make strategic decisions to drive business outcomes.             People management experience, having led a functional consultant team of 10 or more members.

Must have skills : SAP Integrated Business Planning IBP Good to have skills : NA Minimum  12  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Bachelors in Engineering and Masters in Supply chain preferred Summary :As a Business Process Architect, you will be responsible for designing business processes, including characteristics and key performance indicators (KPIs), to meet process and functional requirements. Your typical day will involve working closely with the Application Architect to create the process blueprint and establish business process requirements to drive out application requirements and metrics. You will also assist in quality management reviews and ensure all business and design requirements are met. Additionally, you will educate stakeholders to ensure a complete understanding of the designs. Work closely with the Application Architect to create the process blueprint and establish business process requirements to drive out application requirements and metrics. Assist in quality management reviews and ensure all business and design requirements are met. Educate stakeholders to ensure a complete understanding of the designs. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure successful implementation of business processes. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Experience in SAP Integrated Business Planning IBP. Good To Have Skills:Experience in other SAP modules such as SAP S/4HANA, SAP Ariba, and SAP SuccessFactors. Strong understanding of business process design and optimization. Experience in quality management reviews and ensuring all business and design requirements are met. Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 12 years of experience in SAP Integrated Business Planning IBP. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in business administration, computer science, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful business process solutions. This position is based at our Pune office. Qualification Bachelors in Engineering and Masters in Supply chain preferred

column2: Job Description         IT Purchasing Executive is a pivotal role in a fast paced, customer service-oriented healthcare environment. Our purchasing is largely laptops, desktops, credit card devices, monitors, and networking components like firewalls, switches, and wifi access points. Our IT Operations team maintains a catalog of standard hardware that the Purchasing Associate orders, and we typically order each of these items in high volume.       This position is part-time. IT structure         Maintain vendor relationships         Job REQUIREMENTs           To be considered for this position, applicants need to meet the following qualification criteria:         Previous team in a fast-paced and high-volume environment with emphasis on accuracy and timeliness         Highly motivated team player and willing to take on additional responsibilities as they arise. column2: Job Function   Associate Consultant/Consultant ? IT Security     Joining   Immediate     Location   Malviya Nagar, New Delhi     About Company:   CREATING VALUES Pvt. Ltd. is a Management Consulting firm, providing Strategic Advisory Services in the domains of People Culture Consulting, Information Technology, and Business Strategy Consulting. We create, design innovative and out of the box solutions while enabling our fuelling the growth ambitions of our clients.     Since the last 5+ years we have been working in this Industry alongside large Consulting firms like Big-4s other MNC Management Consulting giants, in offering best of services to drive people effectiveness culture effectiveness within Organizations.       Prime role is to manage the domain of IT Security for Client Organizations.   Lead IT Security Assessment/Technology Risk Assessment/Business Impact Assessment for Client Organizations.   Build Strategy Roadmaps for Security Initiatives deployment covering end to end IT landscape of Client Organizations.   To help set risk and value based priorities for the information security function and plans.   Responsible to perform comprehensive IT Health Assessment comprising comprehensive AS-IS evaluation of the current landscapes of the Organizations and recommend them the TO-BE.   Assist Client Organizations in achieving ISO 27001, ISO 20000 and other similar certifications.   Help Create/Refine IT Policies and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for Client Organizations.   Facilitate Information Security focused change management initiatives for the Client Businesses.   Actively design BCP and DR strategies for the Customer Enterprises.   Conduct Develop Data Classification for Client Organizations.   Building up Business Cases and performing feasibility evaluation of various Cloud Security models for Client Organizations.   The role is mainly of Delivering Designing Client side projects and also to do pre-sales as an information security SME.   Creating proposals and approach notes for clients describing the issues being faced in the current context and the tentative solutions provided by the company.   Ideal Candidate:   Shall be an analyst/consultant (at least) within one of the leading IT consulting companies (Big 4 experience is highly preferred) or shall be possessing an industry recognized certification (ex. CISSP, CISA, CCNA etc.)   Shall ideally be having an experience of 2 ? 5 Years.   Shall be currently working within any one (or more) of the following domains ? IT Audit/Assurance (ex. ITGC, SOX, SSAE, Indian IT Act Clause 49); IT Strategy Security (Cyber Risk, Infrastructure Security, Application Testing); IT Governance (Process Audits, Standards Regulatory Compliances, Software Licensing Audit Assessment, Enterprise Risk Advisory Analytics).   Working exposure of Business Applications Security Aspects (ex. ERP, CRM, SCM, SRM, HRMS, GRC, Business Intelligence) of SAP, Oracle or Microsoft is highly desirable.   Working knowledge of various VA/PT tools and technologies (ex. NMAP, Metasploit, Wireshark) is an added advantage.   Shall have a comprehensive knowledge of different Security products/solutions. Shall be open for travelling for Domestic and International assignments.   Why us:   We provide our team members an opportunity to be the CEO of their role, the opportunity of being empowered to the hilt, an opportunity to perform wider aspects of roles, which individuals wouldn?t have done or will do in their current firms.   We are over here to run a marathon and not sprint. Thus we look for people who will have good long fruitful stay with us where in they create value for our customers organization and we reciprocate it by creating a value for their careers and aspirations.   Expected Benefits:   A chance to be the entrepreneur of your role, besides becoming one of the founding driver of an established start-up. As part of the CK Birla Group, a multibillion-dollar enterprise, we boast a 12,500+ professional team committed to upholding the Group's 162-year legacy. Our core values prioritize Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) initiatives, along with Corporate Sustainable Responsibility (CSR) activities, demonstrating our dedication to building inclusive and sustainable communities. Join us in shaping a future where technology seamlessly aligns with purpose.   OTM Experience expectations 8+ Years (Solution Architect)  3-4 implementation experience. Must be an Oracle certified OTM professional  Participate in and/or lead discovery sessions with client and document as-is processes  Create "to-be" business process designs that meet customer (external and internal) requirements and provide for dynamic management of freight  Should have a good understanding of the Oracle Transportation Management Architecture and fitment of TMS in overall SCM functional and Technical Architecture with ERP and other products  Ability to implement the most advanced product features. Thorough knowledge of system and application design.   Should have a hands on experience on System Performance tunning, Bulk Plan Performance optimization, Cloud Infrastructure, DBA Activisties.  Should have an experience in end to end integrations with WMS, SAP, Mulesoft etc. Having work experience on REST API, JSON will be good  Broad understanding of typical OTM modules like Order Management, Shipment Management, Automation Agents, Sourcing, Freight Forwarding, Vessel-Voyage Scheduling  Should have an experience on PaaS, OIC, VBCS architecture and downstream systems like Goldengate, Replication DB also  Ability to provide solutions in OTM for complex business requirements with must have implementation experience on Road and Ocean solutions.  Leading the support and implementation team  Ability to understand the Customers Global template solution and ensure the new implementations are in line with the Global template solution.  Prepare project plan for the implementation roll outs, identify, and document Current State Processes, Business Requirements, Future State Solutions, Functional Specifications and Configurations  Engage with Oracle for every quarterly patch upgrade. Collaborate with Oracle for any new features and ideas that needs to be implemented  Take the new solutions and product enhancements to Customer and Business team showcasing the benefits of using the new feature.  Should be able to do a comparative study of best in the market solution implemented across the other companies using OTM for the Business requirements.  Investigate system configuration options when developing solutions to meet business requirements; help develop strategies to use standard functionality to meet business needs whenever possible  Soft Skills Excellent Communication skills ??presentation skills, leading discussions with Business/Customer?? IT teams, Presentation to Steerco Meetings  Ability to lead the project, track the team?? daily efforts, motivate the team to provide value adds to the existing set of processes.

column2: The candidate should be a seasoned SAP professional with a proven track record in navigating both ECC and S/4HANA landscapes.              Their expertise should extend to platform capabilities, architecture, project leadership, security, and compliance, ensuring the effective and optimal utilization of SAP systems to drive business success.           A Day in the Life                               Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and implement SAP change and release management processes for S/4HANA transformation projects, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and industry best practices.                          Lead the planning, coordination, and execution of SAP change and release management activities, including assessing impact, scheduling releases, and managing change requests for ECC and S/4HANA systems.                          Develop and maintain release calendars, deployment plans, and rollback procedures to minimize business disruption and ensure successful delivery of changes to production environments.                          Work closely with project managers, development teams, and business stakeholders to prioritize and manage change requests, balancing business needs with system stability and compliance requirements.                          Coordinate with infrastructure and operations teams to ensure that release packages are properly deployed and validated in development, testing, and production environments.                          Monitor and track change and release management metrics and KPIs and provide regular status updates and reports to stakeholders to ensure transparency and accountability.                          Continuously evaluate and improve SAP change and release management processes, tools, and methodologies to increase efficiency, reduce risk, and enhance the overall quality of releases.                          Serve as a subject matter expert for SAP change and release management, providing guidance, training, and support to project teams and stakeholders on best practices and governance standards.                          Stay current with SAP technologies and industry trends related to change and release management, and proactively identify opportunities to leverage new tools or methodologies to improve processes.                          Document SAP change and release management procedures, standards, and best practices, and contribute to knowledge sharing within the organization.                          Participate in meetings, workshops, and training sessions to enhance skills and knowledge related to SAP change and release management and S/4HANA transformation.                          Collaborate with external vendors and partners as needed to support SAP change and release management activities for S/4HANA transformation projects.            Must Have: Minimum Requirements                         Overall 18+ years industry experience                          8+ years of experience in SAP S4                             Strong understanding of SAP change control processes, including managing transports, system landscapes, and release cycles.                          In-depth knowledge of SAP transport management system (STMS) for configuring and managing transport routes, groups, and layers.                          Hands-on experience with SAP Basis administration tasks, including system installations, upgrades, and client copies.                          Familiarity with SAP transport management tools such as CTS+, SAP SLD (System Landscape Directory), and SAP Transport Organizer.                          Expertise in analysing system landscapes and dependencies to assess the impact of changes and plan release schedules accordingly.                          Experience working with development teams to package and release SAP transports, ensuring proper testing and validation in different environments.                          Knowledge of SAP release strategy concepts, including release cycles, release types, and release profiles.                          Proficient in SAP change request management processes, including documenting change requests, assessing risk, and obtaining approvals.                          Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to troubleshoot issues related to SAP change and release management processes.                          Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple concurrent release cycles for different SAP systems.                          Experience working across US and multiple time zones.                             Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.          Nice to Have                         Previous medical device and/or work experience in an FDA regulated industry.                             Experience in SAP Solution Manager functionalities -               o               ChaRM (Change Request Management) for managing change requests, approvals, and documentation.               o               maintenance optimizer, system monitoring, and business process monitoring.

column2: Genzeon has an exciting opening for  Senior TIBCO Administrator  to join our team. Senior TIBCO Administrator Hyderabad, India (Hybrid) Job Description  We are seeking a talented Senior TIBCO Administrator with extensive experience in Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) practices to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for managing our TIBCO infrastructure while also implementing and enhancing CI/CD pipelines to streamline the deployment process.  The ideal candidate will have a strong background in TIBCO administration along with expertise in CI/CD tools and methodologies.  Responsibilities:   TIBCO Infrastructure Management:   Oversee the administration and maintenance of TIBCO infrastructure components, ensuring optimal performance and availability. Install, configure, and upgrade TIBCO software as needed.  Monitor system health and performance and implement tuning and optimization, as necessary.  CI/CD Pipeline Development:    Design, implement, and maintain CI/CD pipelines for TIBCO applications using industry-standard tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD.  Automate build, test, and deployment processes to accelerate software delivery. Integrate TIBCO deployment tasks into CI/CD workflows to achieve seamless deployments.  Version Control and Configuration Management:   Manage source code repositories and version control systems (e.g., Git) for TIBCO projects. Ensure consistency and traceability of configurations across environments using configuration management tools.  Collaboration and Stakeholder Management:   Collaborate with development teams to understand application requirements and facilitate smooth integration with CI/CD pipelines.  Work closely with cross-functional teams to support ongoing projects and initiatives.  Communicate effectively with stakeholders to gather requirements and provide updates on TIBCO infrastructure and CI/CD pipeline status.  Requirements:  ========================  Strong understanding of CI/CD concepts and methodologies.  Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD.  Proficiency in scripting languages like Bash, Python, or Groovy for automation tasks.  Solid knowledge of TIBCO infrastructure components and architecture.  Must have 8-10 years of overall IT experience. Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and configuration management tools.  Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  Relevant certifications such as TIBCO Certified Professional (TCP) or certifications in CI/CD tools are a plus.
column11: Jenkins, Automation, CI/CD pipelines, TIBCO infrastructure, TIBCO applications, TIBCO Certified Professional, Groovy, Gitlab, Python

column2: Consulting | Strategy Analytics & M&A | A&C | Senior Consultant GenAI Automation Tester   Your work profile.   As a  Senior Consultant, Gen AI Automation Tester  in our  Strategy, Analytics and M&A (SAMA)  team, youll build and nurture positive working relationships with teams and clients with the intention to exceed client expectations: -   Design, develop, and maintain  automated test frameworks  and scripts for chat interface applications utilizing large language models (LLMs), ensuring comprehensive coverage of all functionalities and user scenarios. Apply a thorough understanding of  Retrieval Augmented Generation  (RAG) strategies to enhance testing for knowledge-intensive tasks by retrieving relevant documents or data to serve as references or benchmarks for evaluating the LLM's responses. Evaluate chat interactions for  adherence to conversational design principles , ensuring responses are accurate, relevant, and delivered within acceptable time frames. Assess the performance of generative AI models in producing accurate, coherent, and contextually relevant outputs, monitoring for biases, inaccuracies, and inconsistencies in generated content. Validate the quality and relevance of training data used for generative AI models, ensuring data is clean, unbiased, and representative of diverse scenarios. Establish benchmarks and metrics to evaluate the performance of generative AI models and conduct regular performance testing to ensure models meet desired standards. Ensure generative AI models comply with ethical guidelines, industry standards, and regulatory requirements, conducting tests to identify and mitigate potential ethical concerns. Identify, document, and track issues or bugs found during testing, collaborating with the development team to ensure timely resolution of these issues. Desired qualifications 6 to 8 years of overall client facing experience in developing and solutioning digital driven solutions that help optimize traditional processes across LSHC clients in India or outside Experience in leading Testing team A bachelor's degree in information technology or a related field Strong communication skills, power point and Excel advance level knowledge  Agile certifications would be an added advantage

column2: We are looking for an experienced SAP for Utilities Billing Consultant to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for configuring, implementing, and optimizing SAP solutions for utility billing processes. Your expertise in SAP billing modules and utilities industry knowledge will be essential in delivering efficient and accurate billing solutions for our clients.       Key Responsibilities:         Billing Configuration and Implementation:             Requirements Analysis:    Collaborate with utility clients to gather and understand their billing requirements and objectives, including rate structures, billing cycles, and billing determinants.           SAP Billing Solution Implementation:    Configure SAP billing modules to support billing processes, including invoicing, meter reading, tariff management, and bill correction.           Rate Determinants:    Define and configure rate determinants and pricing structures to accurately calculate charges based on meter data and customer contracts.           Billing Cycles:    Set up billing cycles and scheduling to ensure timely and accurate billing for residential, commercial, and industrial customers.           Bill Print and Distribution:    Configure bill printing and distribution processes to generate and deliver bills to customers via various channels.           Bill Correction and Adjustments:    Implement processes for bill corrections, adjustments, and dispute resolution, ensuring accurate billing and customer satisfaction.           Billing Integration:    Ensure seamless integration of billing with other utility systems (e.g., CIS - Customer Information System) to maintain customer account data consistency.           Revenue Recognition:    Configure revenue recognition rules and methods in compliance with accounting standards and industry-specific requirements.           Billing Validation and Testing:             Data Validation:    Implement data validation routines to ensure the accuracy and completeness of billing data.           Testing and Validation:    Conduct rigorous testing of billing solutions, including unit testing, integration testing, and user acceptance testing, to verify functionality and accuracy.           Documentation and Support:             Documentation:    Prepare comprehensive technical documentation, including configuration guides, process flows, and user manuals.           Support and Training:    Provide end-user training and support, assisting with issue resolution, troubleshooting, and query handling.           Continuous Improvement:           Process Optimization:    Stay updated on SAP for Utilities best practices, new features, and industry standards, and make recommendations for process improvements to enhance billing efficiency.         Requirements:         Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, or a related field.     Minimum of 3 years of experience in SAP for Utilities implementation, specifically in billing.     Proficiency in configuring SAP billing modules, including Rate Determinants, Invoicing, and Bill Correction.     Strong understanding of utility industry billing processes and rate structures.     Knowledge of SAP integration techniques and familiarity with other SAP for Utilities modules.     Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.     Effective communication and interpersonal skills.     Ability to work independently and as part of a team.     SAP certification in SAP for Utilities is a plus.

column2: We are looking for a skilled SAP Project System (PS) Consultant to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for configuring, implementing, and optimizing SAP PS solutions to support our clients' project management and execution needs. Your expertise in SAP PS modules and project management processes will be essential in delivering successful project outcomes.       Key Responsibilities:         Project System Configuration and Implementation:             Requirements Analysis:    Collaborate with clients and project managers to gather and understand project management requirements, including project structures, work breakdown structures (WBS), and project planning.           SAP PS Solution Implementation:    Configure SAP PS modules to align with client-specific project management processes, including project planning, budgeting, resource allocation, and monitoring.           Project Structures:    Set up project structures, WBS elements, networks, and activities to facilitate project tracking and reporting.           Project Planning:    Implement project planning tools and methodologies within SAP PS, including scheduling, milestone tracking, and critical path analysis.           Resource Management:    Configure resource management functionalities to allocate and track resources efficiently across projects.           Budget Management:    Establish project budgets, cost centers, and cost planning processes to monitor project financials.           Integration:    Ensure seamless integration of SAP PS with other SAP modules (e.g., SAP Finance, SAP Materials Management) and external project management tools as needed.           Documentation:    Prepare comprehensive technical documentation, including configuration guides, process flows, and user manuals.           Project Monitoring and Reporting:             Project Tracking:    Implement project tracking mechanisms to monitor project progress, costs, and timelines.           Reporting and Analytics:    Develop and maintain project performance reports and dashboards to provide stakeholders with real-time project insights.           Quality Assurance and Testing:             Data Validation:    Implement data validation rules and processes to ensure the accuracy and consistency of project data.           Testing and Validation:    Conduct rigorous testing of SAP PS solutions, including unit testing, integration testing, and user acceptance testing, to verify functionality and accuracy.           Documentation and Support:           Training:    Provide end-user training and support, assisting with issue resolution, troubleshooting, and query handling.         Continuous Improvement:           Process Optimization:    Stay updated on SAP PS best practices, new features, and project management standards, and make recommendations for process improvements to enhance project execution efficiency.         Requirements:         Bachelor's degree in Business, Project Management, or a related field.     Minimum of 3 years of experience in SAP Project System (PS) implementation and support.     Proficiency in configuring SAP PS modules, including project structures, resource management, and budget management.     Strong understanding of project management processes and methodologies.     Knowledge of SAP integration techniques and familiarity with other SAP modules.     Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.     Effective communication and interpersonal skills.     Ability to work independently and as part of a team.     SAP certification in SAP Project System (PS) is a plus.
column11: Manager Quality Assurance, Project management, Integration testing, Project planning, Scheduling, Unit testing, Troubleshooting, Resource management, Analytics, Technical documentation

column2: JOB PURPOSE       As a member of the NGO Program Team, the Senior Manager would manage the NGO partners engaged in implementation of projects supported by NGO / RIST. S/he would identify geographical locations with low (HDI) and identify potential and credible NGOs to undertake project implementation. The project would aim at addressing immediate, intermediate and underlying causes of problems.      The position would be accountable for the deliverables and the effectiveness of projects in meeting the success indicators defined in the logical framework.       KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES       A. Identification of Partners:     i. Identify potential partners in different geographical regions of India with low Human Development Index under the programming priorities of Foundation.     ii. Review Concept Notes submitted by the potential partners. Also, undertake reviews of proposals submitted by the partners for funding against the sectoral approaches of Foundation.     B. Review of Proposals: Finalise proposals by the potential partners based on the observations of the Proposal Review Committee and RIST. Accordingly, Prepare One-Pagers for approval of projects by NGO and RIST.     C. Agreement and Documentation: Facilitate the Equal Determination process of the partners and coordinate for availability of all the documents. Signing of agreements by the partners and RIST and ensure uploading of all documents in the SMA tool of RIST.     D. Monitoring and Evaluation:     i. Monitor projects to ensure that deliverables are achieved with quality and within budget and timelines.     ii. Carry out a review of partners reports and conduct analysis in terms of accomplishments of deliverables, quality of reporting, utilization of budget and the overall timelines and provide feedback to partners.     iii. Carry routine structured check-ins with the partners over call for each projects and have updated knowledge about the projects.     iii. Embark on field visits to monitor projects against defined Terms of Reference

column2: Mandatory- 6- 10 Years of Capital Markets Domain Experience along with Consulting background MBA/ PGDM  from top-tier business schools  Primary locations:  Bangalore, Chennai, Gurgaon, Hyderabad, Mumbai, Pune Other locations:  Bhubaneshwar, Chandigarh, Jaipur, Mysore, Mangalore, Nagpur, Noida, Gurgaon, Thiruvananthapuram, Indore, Kolkata Who are we?  Infosys (NYSE: INFY) is a global leader in consulting, technology and outsourcing solutions with annual revenues of $18+ B as of March 2023. We enable clients, in more than 50 countries, to stay a step ahead of emerging business trends and outperform the competition.  Infosys Consulting partners with clients to transform their businesses in areas such as strategy, processes, organization, systems, and risk. Infosys Consulting has offices across the US, Europe, APAC, and India. In FY23, Infosys Consulting was one of the fastest growing units at Infosys with over 24% YoY revenue growth.  We are Value Integrators we deliver realized business value by managing transformations from strategy through execution, including operating and optimizing delivered solutions.  The Consulting team in India works with its overseas counterparts to provide business consulting services to clients in the US, Europe, Asia Pacific and Middle East markets.  At Infosys Consulting, we recognize the need for greater Diversity and Inclusion at the workplace, and on this journey, we place special emphasis on enabling gender diversity. Women form an integral part of our company and we do all that we can to build an inclusive, supportive, and safe workplace. What are we looking for? We are looking for smart, self-driven, high energy people with top notch communication skills, intellectual curiosity and passion for excellence. Our consultants have a blend of in-depth domain expertise, strong business consulting skills and excellent soft skills. We are looking for people with a deep understanding of financial services and in-depth expertise in Capital Markets domain within Financial Services, with experience in one or more of the following areas:  Domain Expertise in one or more of the following areas:  Capital Markets: Investment Banking, Private Banking, Wealth Management, Market Infra, Retirement Services  Retirement Services: Retirement Services, Defined Contribution, Defined Benefits, 401(k) plans, Recordkeeping  Horizontal Consulting in Financial Services: Business Strategy, IT Strategy, Process Consulting, Cost Optimization, Customer Experience, Digital Transformation, Program Management, Change Management, Product Implementation, Business Architecture, Business Analysis and Post-merger Integration, Agile delivery, Automation  Consulting & advisory experience with top-tier consulting organizations strongly preferred  Full time MBA from top-tier business schools  Driving digital strategy for FSI clients using key emerging technologies likes Artificial Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, Omni/Conversational Channels, Cloud, Blockchain, Social & Mobility What will you do? At Infosys Consulting, you will:  Work on business consulting engagements as part of a cross-cultural team across regions  Take up a range of roles in the areas of process consulting, functional consulting, tech strategy, program management and change management  Analyze problems and come up with solutions, often creative and out-of-the-box  Apply business consulting frameworks and methodologies to address business problems  Be responsible for the delivery of business results to clients  Lead workshops to collaborate with client stakeholders and educate them throughout the process  Lead / contribute to sales pursuits, consulting offerings and internal initiatives  Participate in a variety of Firm building events and the consultant referral program What do we require? We are seeking success-oriented people who have a consulting mindset, strong analytical skills, a competitive drive, and an entrepreneurial spirit that will help propel the continued growth of the firm. We look for candidates that have prior relevant work experience, excel in ambiguous situations and possess a passion for helping companies become more competitive. Business acumen combined with a comfort with technology is a must as well as strong verbal and written communication skills. Candidates must be able to quickly frame complex business problems and prioritize root causes with confidence. We pride ourselves on hiring consultants that immediately fit into the fun yet professional atmosphere of Infosys Consulting. We value intellectual curiosity, initiative, and entrepreneurial drive!
column11: Digital Transformation, Capital Market, Capital Markets, Wealth Management, Business Consulting, Financial Transformation, Investment Banking, Management Consulting, Consulting, Business Transformation

column2: Instructional Design Consultant  - SAP Join our team in Talent & Organization and f ind endless opportunities to  solve the most pressing client needs and challenges, especially during the backdrop of a global pandemic as we adapt to the new norm.  Practice: Talent & Organization  | Job Title : Instructional Design Consultant - SAP ,  Global Network  I Areas of Work: Learning Strategy, Design and Development | Level: Consultant  |  Location: Gurugram ,  Bangalore , Mumbai, Pune, Hyderabad , Kolkata,  and Chennai  |  Years  of Exp: 6+ years Explore an Exciting Career at Accenture Are you an outcome-oriented problem solver? Do you enjoy working on transformation strategies for global clients? Does working in an inclusive and collaborative environment spark your interest? Then, Accenture  Global  Strategy and Consulting is the right place for you to explore limitless possibilities. The Practice- A Brief Sketch: Aligned to the  strategic priorities of our clients , we are committed to activating human potential to drive enterprise transformation across industries. At  Global Network , we help clients navigate disruption, accelerate  growth,  and create value while staying agile in an ever-changing business environment. As a part of our high-impact  team, you will help drive the following:  Understand SAP business processes (e.g.,Record to Report, Procure to Pay, Order to Cash, Plan to Manufacture, Distribute to Deliver, Master Data Governance) and how they relate to learning solution design.  Collaborate with client team to understand business problem, identify solution approach, and work through design, development, and delivery phases of custom, role-based, blendedlearning programs for large-scale business transformation programs enabled by SAP technology.  Provide solutions tocomplex client problems across SAP project lifecycle, providing subject matter expertise on SAP process areas/functions/learning with a strong strategic awareness of market and associated technologies.  Subject matter expertise in developing high-quality and detailed content outlines as per SAPlearning curriculum.  Assist Training Leads/Consultants  in reviewing detailed SAP course designs and storyboards for instructor-led trainings (ILTs), web-based trainings (WBTs), and other performance support materials including job aids, simulations, exercise sheets, guided tours, etc.  Engage with deployment team or client business team  to resolve queries and obtain required inputs.  Participate actively  in content review, revision, and sign-off cycles.  Bring your best skills forward to excel in the role: Leverageproficiency in agile methodologies  along with theknowledge of latest trends in technology.  Apply your strong SAP functional and business process knowledge .  Be proficient in Microsoft Suite, including Word, PowerPoint, and Excel.  Prioritize and manage  the assigned tasks and meet the desired milestones.  Thrive in a fast-paced , project-driven environment.  Work in a  problem-solving global environment with Cross cultural competence .  Possess excellent  interpersonal and writing skills  with a strong  business acumen .  Read  more  about us. Qualification Your experience counts! Graduate/Postgraduate in any specialization Professional Background - Desirable any of the following certifications. Some references are listed below: SAP S/4HANA Cloud  Finance, Manufacturing, Sourcing and Procurement, Supply Chain, Warehouse Management, Sales, R&D / Engineering, Asset Management, Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management, Service Management SuccessFactors  Core HR and Payroll, Talent Management (incl. Recruiting and Onboarding, Succession Development, Compensation, Performance and Goals,Learning Management Systems), Employee Experience Management, HR Analytics and Workforce Planning, Sales Performance Management 6 years of SAP HANA orSuccessFactors project experience.  Experience in creating Business Process Documents or Procedures (BPDs/BPPs), Functional Design Documents (FDDs), Quick Reference Guides (QRGs), or Classroom Trainings for key SAP applications/modules, e.g., Finance, Manufacturing, Sourcing, Procurement, etc.  Experience in working with onsite client account teams alongside client teams. What's  in it for you? An opportunity to work on

column2: Role & responsibilities   An Application Lead for SAP Vistex, you will be responsible for leading the effort to design, build, and configure applications. You will act as the primary point of contact and work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure successful project delivery. Your typical day will involve collaborating with stakeholders, designing and implementing solutions, and providing technical guidance to team members. Roles & Responsibilities: - Lead the design, development, and implementation of SAP Vistex solutions, ensuring adherence to best practices and standards. - Act as the primary point of contact for all SAP Vistex-related queries, providing technical guidance and support to cross-functional teams. - Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, design solutions, and provide estimates for project delivery. - Provide technical leadership to team members, ensuring adherence to coding standards, best practices, and project timelines. - Conduct code reviews, identify areas of improvement, and implement solutions to enhance the performance and scalability of SAP Vistex applications. Professional & Technical Skills: - Must To Have Skills: Strong experience in SAP Vistex development, including configuration, customization, and integration with other SAP modules. - Good To Have Skills: Experience with SAP S/4HANA, SAP ABAP, and SAP Fiori. - Solid understanding of SAP Vistex functionality, including pricing, rebates, and chargebacks. - Experience with SAP Vistex data models, tables, and interfaces. - Strong knowledge of SAP Vistex integration with other SAP modules, including SAP SD, SAP MM, and SAP FI. - Experience with SAP Vistex reporting and analytics tools, including SAP BW and SAP BOBJ. Additional Information: - The candidate should have a minimum of 3 years of experience in SAP Vistex development. - The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science, engineering, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering SAP Vistex solutions. - SAP Vistex  Preferred candidate profile   Perks and benefits

column2: Job Description: Position Overview As a CPQ Consultant with Crowe Horwath IT Services LLP you will play a key role on our project team by bridging the gap between business problems and technical solutions for our clients. You will engage with our project teams & customers to understand client needs, design & build custom CPQ solutions, and deliver & implement innovative real-world solutions using Salesforce best practices and our highest standards. Key Responsibilities Include Demonstrable expertise as a Salesforce Consultant and have the technical aptitude required to understand data models, solutions, system integrations, automation (including Flows) and implement such through the configuration of the Salesforce platform Work closely with key stakeholders to capture business needs, define requirements and business processes Work at discretion of a Solution Architect or Engagement Lead for project implementation & architectural design by both solutioning and delivering on workstreams as identified & assigned Desire to learn and eager to extend your Salesforce prowess. Most importantly you love to share your knowledge with others High level of initiative, drive and ownership with a focus on achieving quality outcomes Participate in QA of all completed work, as needed  Ability to analyze complex client objectives and processes to create technical and training documentation including delivering client demos & end user training for clientele, as needed  Assume joint responsibility for the success of the project end-to-end with Project Manager & delivery team members Experience & Requirements (Our ideal candidate will possess the following skills) Deep Understanding of the Lead-To-Cash business process and supporting technologies 3.5+ years consulting and/or Lead to Cash (CPQ/ CLM) implementation experience. Experience managing multiple enterprise large-scale full-life cycle implementations of Lead to Cash (CPQ/ CLM) solutions Demonstrated competency & experience with Salesforce CPQ & Sales Cloud required and exposure to Conga and other Salesforce core products, highly preferred Salesforce CPQ Certifications and a minimum of 3.5+ years experience on the Salesforce platform Experience within Manufacturing/FinServ/SaaS is a huge plus! Experience managing & delivering multiple projects at the same time Experience successfully leading and owning multiple enterprise strategic projects from end to end Experience providing business/operations/technical consulting to senior leaders of organization from SMB to Enterprise Detail-oriented, enthusiastic, self-starter with ability to work both independently and in a team environment- ability to manage a delivery team is a must! Strong, dynamic communication skills - both written & verbal - with ability to work cross-functionally and speak to members at any level of an organization (both client & prospect) Ability to log time on a daily basis for client and project reporting needs Positive minded, solutions-oriented approach and outlook is critical Ability to work - and thrive - in a fast-paced, high-growth, innovative environment Prior leadership experience highly desired Excellent written and verbal communication skills Work closely with U.S. based teams and clients Our Benefits: At Crowe, we know that great people are what makes a great firm. We value our people and offer employees a comprehensive benefits package. Learn more about what working at Crowe can mean for you! How You Can Grow: We will nurture your talent in an inclusive culture that values diversity. You will have the chance to meet on a consistent basis with your Career Coach that will guide you in your career goals and aspirations. Learn more about where talent can prosper!

These services help our clients become living businesses by  optimizing  their marketing,  sales,  and customer service strategy, thereby driving cost reduction, revenue enhancement, customer satisfaction and  impacting  business metrics in a positive manner. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand client requirements, conceptualize creative solutions, and execute projects that exceed expectations. Work closely with project manager and consultants to curateand deliver best suited long-term Generative AI solution to address the client requirement.  Work as a Business Analyst to collect and document client requirements. Design and help develop tailored solutions, considering clients' business objectives.  Work with creative teams to brainstorm and develop innovative concepts and designs that leverage the full potential of the Adobe Firefly platform.  Create multimedia content, including graphics, animations, videos, and interactive elements, to enhance user engagement and interactivity.  Demonstrate functional & technical expertise on Generative AI along with broad understanding of text-to-image and large language models (LLMs). Ability to learn and understand new tools/solutions.  An understanding of copy, content, and design and end to end content supply chain.  Proficient in marketing research and analysis. Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite, including Adobe XD, Photoshop, Illustrator, and After Effects. Experience in UX design, design systems and close collaboration with design teams. Deep marketing, functional and technical understanding of models for Generative AI. column2: Project Role : Application Designer Project Role Description : Assist in defining requirements and designing applications to meet business process and application requirements.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             Must have skills : Workday Core Integrations, Workday Core Connectors Good to have skills : NA Minimum 5 year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Workday certification in the Primary skill and additional skill is preferred but not mandatory. Summary:  As an Application Designer, you will be responsible for assisting in defining requirements and designing applications to meet business process and application requirements. column2: The Professional Services Consultant is a member of our consulting group that delivers configurable solutions to our end user customers and partners. The Professional Services Consultant is represented to our Partners and End Users as being the subject matter expert in the configuration and customization of Tungsten Automation Corporation products.                           ?         Key Responsibilities               Consultants are expected to provide first-class customer service while managing multiple projects concurrently. They must demonstrate strong organizational skills and be able to professionally communicate with customers, management, and other members of the Professional Services, Sales, and Product Development and Support teams.                       Consultants must work efficiently in a team environment and provide consistent communication and project documentation to the customer and other team members such as project managers and other consultants. They must also demonstrate the ability to apply technology to provide solutions for business needs.                 Consultants are responsible for technical component delivery and assumes responsibility for testing the application code to verify that programs follow standards and meets technical specifications. The Consultant will actively participate in work groups and work sessions with functional and technical consultants.                                   As part of a rapidly growing company, it is also highly encouraged to develop professional skills and take advantage of given opportunities for advancement.                                     An extensive training program is provided as part of the consultant onboarding program that includes extensive software training as well as shadowing experienced consultants in solution design and implementations.                       Required Skills          Strong written communication, clear verbal communication and presentation skills to enable interactions with a global employee and customer base     Multiple language skills are a plus (eg, French, German, Dutch, etc)                   Consultative communications style, effective listener       Work collaboratively with team members, u   nderstand team objectives and help team meet these objectives       Understand customer s goals and objectives           Adhere to established work schedule and plans       Demonstrate attention to detail     Good communication and analytical skills and will have the ability to identify and resolve technical problems. You will be a team player with excellent organization skills, be self- motivated, willing to learn and develop in a technical SAP ABAP environment.     Demonstrate strong listening skills, asking questions to clarify for understanding     The ability to develop and manage multiple projects and project teams simultaneously while remaining detail-oriented           Strong technical, analytical, and problem solving/troubleshooting skills             Escalate support issues with appropriate internal resources when necessary       Transfer/share technical knowledge to others team members     Accurately and professionally document all work           Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Visio)       Ability to work alternative shift client hours when necessary     Ability to travel to customer project locations as needed                 Qualifications           Experience with Tungsten Automation Corporation products or equivalent products from both a functional and technical perspective       bachelors Degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Information Systems or related specialization.     CA/CPA/MBA finance is a plus         4+ years experience    successfully    implementing Tungsten Automation Corporation, SAP or equivalent products                     A good understanding of SAP ECC6 or later. You will have a good knowledge of ABAP and will ideally have a minimum of 24 months of ABAP development in a commercial software environment, within at least one full project lifecycle. And at least 4 years of SAP experience.                     Good ABAP skills, ideally with some knowledge of FICO/MM, looking for a wide ranging and varied set of challenges and an opportunity to develop their career. Experience of Sales Orders, Order Requisitions, Project Systems, SRM, BW and SAP PI will be of benefit.                     Ability to collect and document business requirements, technical requirements and process flows                     SAP Development Experience in at least two of the following modules: FI, CO, MM, SD, PS and BW                     Experienced in Producing Functional and Technical Specifications                     Good understanding of ABAP Objects. SAP BW/BI an advantage                     Extensive experience of Enhancing standard SAP functionality using User Exits and BADI s, BTE s                     Able to create and maintain Archives using SAP Content Server                     Consultants will have excellent programming knowledge in SAP development and testing.          The Consultant must be capable of following the standard life cycle development process and will work closely with our functional configuration consultants to ensure accuracy and completeness of functional requirements and development of ABAP programs, according to specifications.
